ETYMOLOGY: From New Latin encyclopaedia, from Ancient Greek enkyklios paideia (ἐγκύκλιος παιδεία) meaning 'all-round education' or 'general education', literally 'in a circle of instruction'. The American spelling is 'encyclopedia'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A book or set of books giving information on many subjects or on many aspects of one subject, usually arranged alphabetically.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一本或一套书籍，包含多个主题或一个主题的多个方面的信息，通常按字母顺序排列。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He spent hours poring over the articles in the old encyclopaedia.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他花了数小时仔细研读那本旧百科全书里的文章。
